intro: Theriophonum uniseriatum, commonly known as the single-rowed thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Theriophonum uniseriatum typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and scrub habitats. Its botanical features make it an important plant for local pollinators and a subject of study in ecological research.
